title: Emotional cost of racist abuse the most significant consequence of Haringey Borough's re-staging of FA Cup match
text:
It has been an expensive week for the Haringey Borough chairman Aki Achillea, who has had to spend £5,000 of the club’s money to ensure that none of the travelling Yeovil Town fans who come to the tiny Coles Park stadium this Tuesday will be in a position to racially abuse his players again.

What to say of those few last Saturday who went all the way to north London to spit at and racially abuse a non-league goalkeeper? The tragics of the cup? Either way, Yeovil fans are coming back to Haringey. The Football Association has ordered this now notorious FA Cup fourth qualifying round tie...
description: It has been an expensive week for the Haringey Borough chairman Aki Achillea, who has had to spend £5,000 of the club’s money to ensure that none of the travelling Yeovil Town fans who come to the tiny Coles Park stadium this Tuesday will be in a position to racially abuse his players again.
